intro: Draba mulliganii, commonly known as the Mulligan's whitlow grass, is a small flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight. The plant produces delicate white or pale yellow flowers in early spring, which are clustered in dense, umbel-like inflorescences. Its leaves are basal, rosette-forming, and covered in a fine layer of silky hairs. Draba mulliganii is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants such as cabbages and mustards.
